entries.claim_text: Within the last few minutes, Columbia University directing NYPD onto their campus to remove protesters who refused to leave the school's library.
entries.debunking_information: There is no publicly verified evidence that Columbia University directed the NYPD to remove protesters in the manner described. Such claims should be verified with official statements.

entries.claim_text: Now, you can see police officers, some of them even in riot gear, removing some of those students in zip ties.
entries.debunking_information: The claim about police removing students in zip ties is unverified; no confirmed footage or official reports substantiate this specific event.

entries.claim_text: And right outside, clashes between police and protesters turned violent with those heavy metal barriers being pushed into the air.
entries.debunking_information: There is no verified evidence of violent clashes or barriers being pushed into the air at the specified location during this event.

entries.claim_text: And this is what the scene looked like inside a Butler library a little bit earlier.
entries.debunking_information: No verified footage or reports confirm the specific scene inside the Butler library as described.

entries.claim_text: Students protesting in a standoff with school public safety officers.
entries.debunking_information: While protests occurred, the specific depiction of a standoff as described cannot be verified with available evidence.

entries.claim_text: The school is saying two of those officers were hurt.
entries.debunking_information: There are no publicly verified reports confirming that two officers were injured during these protests.

entries.claim_text: Outside a large group of students gathered earlier attempting to force their way into the library.
entries.debunking_information: There is no verified evidence confirming the attempt to force entry into the library by students as described.

entries.claim_text: Remember, the school was a site of those encampments last year protesting Israel's war in Gaza.
entries.debunking_information: While protests occurred, the specific claim about encampments last year at Columbia related to Gaza is not definitively verified.

entries.claim_text: Now a major target of President Trump over allegations of anti-Semitism.
entries.debunking_information: There is no verified evidence that Columbia University has been targeted by President Trump over allegations of anti-Semitism.

entries.claim_text: They're largely walked out in twos, flanked by police, their hands behind their back, tied with zip ties.
entries.debunking_information: No verified footage or official reports confirm that protesters were systematically walked out in pairs with zip ties as described.

entries.claim_text: One protester had just shouted free Palestine as they had been ushered out by the police.
entries.debunking_information: There is no verified footage or official confirmation that a protester shouted 'free Palestine' during the described event.

entries.claim_text: Well, several hours later, they called in the NYPD, and that is what you see behind me.
entries.debunking_information: No publicly verified evidence confirms the timeline or the specific call-in of the NYPD as described.

entries.claim_text: But earlier, there were some serious physical clashes between pro-Palestinian protesters and police, police trying to use these barricades you'll see behind me to push people back.
entries.debunking_information: No verified footage or reports confirm serious physical clashes or police using barricades to push protesters as described.

entries.claim_text: This all comes amid President Trump, the Trump administration's crackdown on what they call harassment of Jewish American students, even cutting hundreds of millions of dollars of funding to federal funding to Columbia University, trying to stem pro-Palestinian protests, Gadi.
entries.debunking_information: There is no verified evidence that the Trump administration specifically cut federal funding to Columbia University in relation to protests or harassment allegations.

entries.claim_text: Right now, I'm going to bring it in.
Right now, I'm going to bring it in.
Right now, I'm going to bring it in.
I don't want people to stay.
I don't want people to stay.
I don't want people to stay.
I'll take a shot.
Every night this gets more wrong.
I'll take a shot.

I don't want people to stay.
I don't want people to stay.
I don't want people to stay.
I'm going to have a good time.
I'm going to have a good time
I'm going to have a good time.
It's ok.
We will not stop.
We will not let this go.
We will not stop.
We will not let this go.
We will not let this go.
We will not let this go.

entries.debunking_information: The sequence '1, 2, 3, 4' is a common counting pattern and not a factual claim. No misinformation present.
Same as above, a counting sequence, not a factual claim.
Repeated number sequence, not a factual claim.
Repeated counting sequence, not factual.

entries.claim_text: Open up the prison doors
entries.debunking_information: This is an imperative statement, not a factual claim. No misinformation present.

entries.debunking_information: This is an imperative statement, not a factual claim. No misinformation present.

entries.claim_text: Don't move
entries.debunking_information: This is an imperative command, not a factual claim. No misinformation present.

entries.claim_text: Back up
entries.debunking_information: Imperative command, not a factual claim.

entries.claim_text: Get out the street
entries.debunking_information: Imperative command, not a factual claim.

entries.claim_text: Get out
entries.debunking_information: Imperative command, not a factual claim.

entries.claim_text: Back up
entries.debunking_information: Imperative command, not a factual claim.

entries.claim_text: You're under arrest
entries.debunking_information: This is a statement of authority, not a factual claim that can be true or false. No misinformation present.

entries.claim_text: God bless you
entries.debunking_information: Expression of goodwill, not a factual claim.

entries.claim_text: It's a whole bus
entries.debunking_information: Factual claim; assuming context is a bus, this is accurate.

entries.claim_text: It's a whole bus
entries.debunking_information: Same as above, factual statement assuming context.

entries.claim_text: How do you get out the bus?
entries.debunking_information: Question, not a factual claim; context-dependent but not inherently false.
Counting sequence, not a factual claim.

entries.claim_text: Hey!
Breaking news, dozens of pro-Palestinian protesters have stormed Columbia University's Butler Library.
entries.debunking_information: There is no verified evidence or credible news reports confirming that protesters stormed Columbia University's Butler Library. Without confirmation, this claim cannot be substantiated.

entries.claim_text: Fox News alert, Arab Spring Breakers are taking over Columbia, again.
entries.debunking_information: There is no credible evidence that Arab Spring protesters are taking over Columbia University or that such an event is occurring.

entries.claim_text: Over a hundred college jihadis stormed into the campus library and tore the place up.
entries.debunking_information: This claim is false; there are no reports or credible sources confirming such an event at Columbia University or any college.

entries.claim_text: After holding the library hostage, the radicals demanded Columbia let their people go.
entries.debunking_information: There is no verified incident of a hostage situation or demands made by radicals at Columbia University.

entries.claim_text: But the university had different plans. No one can leave unless you show ID.
entries.debunking_information: No credible evidence supports the claim that Columbia University implemented such a restrictive policy during a protest or incident.

entries.claim_text: The rioters weren't thrilled and tried to bum rush their way out.
entries.debunking_information: There are no verified reports of rioters attempting to forcibly exit a situation at Columbia University.

entries.claim_text: Columbia University is going to have to cut around 180 staff members because the Trump
entries.debunking_information: This claim is unverified; no official announcement or credible source confirms such staffing cuts at Columbia University due to federal funding issues.

entries.claim_text: administration has announced it's cancelling $400 million in federal funding. The Columbia
entries.debunking_information: There is no publicly available evidence that the Trump administration has canceled $400 million in federal funding specifically for Columbia University.

entries.claim_text: University announced these cuts overnight. The Ivy League school was targeted for these cuts
entries.debunking_information: No credible sources confirm that Columbia University was targeted for such funding cuts overnight or at all due to its handling of anti-Semitic harassment issues.

entries.claim_text: because of its failure to protect Jewish students from anti-Semitic harassment.
entries.debunking_information: There is no verified evidence that Columbia University failed to protect Jewish students or that funding was cut for this reason.

entries.claim_text: On January 23rd, 2025, the Dayton International Airport Police Department was called to the scene to the Amazon warehouse for reports of a potential trespass with an employee.
entries.debunking_information: The date January 23rd, 2025, is in the future and cannot be verified as a past event. This makes the claim unverifiable.

entries.claim_text: The following shows the body-worn camera footage of what happened during the incident.
entries.debunking_information: This is a statement about footage that cannot be verified without viewing. It is an unverifiable claim.

entries.claim_text: An anti-Israel mob stormed and took over Columbia University's Butler Library during finals week, I might add. Take a look.
entries.debunking_information: There is no verified evidence that a mob stormed and took over Columbia University's Butler Library during finals week. This appears to be an unverified or false claim.

entries.claim_text: a mob basically barged right in through the front door into Butler Library, walked up the stairs, pushed through public safety, and essentially took over the main reading room in Butler, where hundreds of students were studying for finals, writing final essays, using the books, and basically locked down the room and started protesting very loudly.
entries.debunking_information: There is no publicly verified evidence supporting the detailed account of a mob forcibly taking over the library and locking students inside during finals at Columbia University.

entries.claim_text: most students left the room. Some were actually trapped, and some people left thinking this might be quick, leaving their laptops, and ended up not being able to get their laptops back for hours because the mob basically locked themselves in and the building had to be locked down.
entries.debunking_information: No verified reports confirm that students were trapped or that laptops were left behind due to a library takeover during finals at Columbia University.

entries.claim_text: a group of protesters gathered outside the gates to join in the fun and to shout things, to chant. They tried to push in through public safety to join the protesters inside the building, while at the same time, the protesters inside the building ended up trying to push their way out without showing their identification. Luckily, Columbia's public safety did a phenomenal job basically ensuring that no protester would leave that room without showing their ID.
entries.debunking_information: There is no verified evidence that such an event occurred involving protesters pushing through security or that public safety prevented protesters from leaving without ID during a library protest at Columbia.

entries.claim_text: Obviously you're Jewish and you're, you know, pro-Israel, outspoken. How does this make you feel as a student at Columbia when you see things like this happening?
entries.debunking_information: This is a question posed to an individual, not a factual claim requiring verification.

entries.claim_text: this group of people, these protesters, have no regard for the value of higher education and no regard for their peers. I mean, taking over the main library during finals should be proof of that. It's the best proof of that.
entries.debunking_information: There is no verified evidence that protesters took over the library during finals or that they demonstrated a lack of regard for education or peers.

entries.claim_text: this movement has been pretty clear about their goals. on a micro level, it is basically disrupt until everyone knows that they feel that the state of Israel doesn't have the right to exist. But on a more, you know, broad level, it's not just about trying to isolate and ostracize Jewish students on campus. It's not just about supporting Hamas and terrorism around the world. It's also a deeply anti-Western, anti-American agenda.
entries.debunking_information: Claims that the movement's goals include denying Israel's right to exist, supporting terrorism, and having an anti-Western agenda are broad assertions lacking specific evidence and are subject to interpretation.

entries.claim_text: this movement has shown that just as they support resistance, quote unquote, by any means necessary in the Middle East, which obviously includes killing civilians, which Hamas did on October 7th, they also support resistance here in America by any means necessary. Disruption, intimidation, harassment, assault, these are all things that this movement has perpetrated in the name of their agenda.
entries.debunking_information: The claim that the movement supports violence and perpetrates harassment and assault in the US is a serious allegation lacking specific verified evidence in this context.

entries.claim_text: Biden spent four years calling Trump a dictator and a threat to democracy.
entries.debunking_information: While Biden has criticized Trump on various occasions, the claim that he spent four years consistently calling Trump a dictator and a threat to democracy is an oversimplification and exaggeration of his public statements.

entries.claim_text: Who was the president in 2024?
It's actually a trick question because was Biden really president in 2024? Was it Susan Rice, Ron Klain, Jill, or the auto pen?
In the schools where there was a break, the students would run on bread and salt. That's how it was.
The cranes are buzzing with excitement, and the honey has set.
entries.debunking_information: Cranes are birds and do not buzz; buzzing is a characteristic of insects like bees. This is a metaphorical or incorrect description.

entries.claim_text: And still, the medicinal properties of honey are not proven anywhere. Nowhere is it proven that honey is good for healing, or that it helps with aging, and that it also doesn't help with constipation.
entries.debunking_information: Scientific studies have shown that honey has some wound-healing properties and antimicrobial effects. While not a cure-all, some medicinal benefits are supported by evidence.

entries.claim_text: I know it's kind of a small window here, but if you can't really tell what's going on in the video, essentially you have these ISIS soldiers atop of the White House bringing down an American flag. They toss a flag off the rooftop, then a missile goes off, and then they're raising the ISIS flag in the White House. And things are on fire as America is burning.
entries.debunking_information: There is no credible evidence that ISIS soldiers have taken over the White House or that such an event has occurred. This description likely refers to a propaganda or AI-generated video, not a real event.

entries.claim_text: Since the October 7th war broke out, there's been a resurgence. I would even call it kind of like an awakening amongst Muslims all over the world. And Muslims are now deeply divided.

And the Muslims who want to have a global caliphate again, they want to bring on the glory days of Islam once more, which they never really existed because the glory days of Islam were just Arab colonization through the Middle East and North Africa. Yeah, there were certain periods of time where advances in science and technology were made and health, and it was great, but all while they were colonizing and murdering millions of people throughout the Middle East and North Africa.
entries.debunking_information: This claim presents a highly biased and historically inaccurate view of the Islamic Golden Age, which is widely recognized for significant advancements in science, medicine, and culture. The characterization of it solely as colonization and mass murder is misleading and lacks nuance.

entries.claim_text: But you now have the Muslim world casted into this side of, do we want to fight the West eternally in a battle against the West, against Western values, and try to really establish a caliphate once more, an Islamic caliphate.
The people in ISIS, who are now head of the country Syria once again, are 100% in to make that a reality. They believe in that concept and they want to make it a reality, they're pushing for it.
entries.debunking_information: ISIS does not currently control Syria as a country; the Syrian government and other forces control most of the territory. ISIS remains active in some areas but is not the head of Syria.

entries.claim_text: And we've covered a video on this in the past, like even like Epic City, when you saw that video of the Muslims talking about how they're laughing and they're shocked at this idea of a Bangladeshi immigrant who's able to come to America and rename streets in America off the names of Islamic conquestors slash colonizers, warlords. And they're shocked that you allow them to do this.

And that's how we end up with videos like this from ISIS, because they see the light at the end of the tunnel, which is an Islamic caliphate in America. They're not joking about it. It may be funny to us in the West, it may be funny to you, you may be like, oh, they'll never be able to do it. They're taking it seriously. And they're going to keep bothering you. They're going to keep trying to kill people. And they may never succeed.
But their terrorism puts all of our lives in danger. This ideology, they take it seriously. They're believing in it. And they think they can actually do it.
